messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/auth.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\UserController@update (PUT|PATCH)` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/settings/account`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/auth.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\\Http\\Controllers\\UserController@update (PUT|PATCH)`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

{'stdout': 'app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php:13:class UserController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php:13:class UserController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php:12:class UserController extends Controller
', 'stderr': ''}

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Paths to files containing the handler implementations for App\Http\Controllers\UserController@update (PUT|PATCH):

- app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php

Explanation:
- In routes/auth.php, the route for updating the user settings at /settings/account is defined as a PUT/PATCH request mapped to UserController@update.
- The actual implementation of App\Http\Controllers\UserController@update is found in app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php. This method uses a UsersRequest, authorizes the current user, updates the user with the validated data, and redirects back to the settings edit page with a success message. There are no other files implementing App\Http\Controllers\UserController@update in this codebase. Note: there are other UserController classes under different namespaces (e.g., Admin or Api), but they are not the same App\Http\Controllers\UserController referenced by the route.
